intro: Hoffmannseggia trifoliata var. trifoliata, commonly known as the three-leafed hoffmannseggia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The species is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets arranged symmetrically. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. This plant thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories.
